com.sri.ai.util.rangeoperation.api

Interface DependencyAwareEnvironment

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultDependencyAwareEnvironment

    @Beta
public interface DependencyAwareEnvironment
extends java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>
    An extension of Map that is able to keep track and manage dependencies between its entries as computed by DAEFunctions. If a variable v1 depends on v2 and v2 is changed, we want v1 to be removed so it is recalculated next time its value is requested.

    This is useful if we want to use the map as a store for multiple variables and want to make sure that all stored values are valid and consistent.

    This works by computing new values using DAEFunctions. These are functions from an environment to a new value (stored under the function's String representation) with the method getResultOrRecompute(DAEFunction). This method monitors accesses made by the function to the environment in order to determine which values depend on which other values. This monitoring is possible due to DAEFunctions only being able to access the environment through methods get(String) and getResultOrRecompute(DAEFunction), because these methods have internal hooks that do the necessary bookkeeping automatically.

    If a DAEFunction's method DAEFunction.isRandom() returns true, or depends on a value computed by a random DAEFunction, it is always recomputed since its values cannot be reused.

    Author:
    braz

    • Method Detail

      • getResultOrRecompute

        java.lang.Object getResultOrRecompute(DAEFunction function)
        Parameters:
        function - the function to be evaluated.
        Returns:
        the result of the evaluation of a DAEFunction on the current environment, only actually evaluating it if the variables it depends on have been changed since the last evaluation (during which invocations of get(String) are monitored in order to determine such dependencies).
